items.name: Object_Layout
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Object_Layout
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Object_Layout extends gs.Object_Base
    ###*
    * A layout object defines a new UI layout game scene. A UI layout scene
    * displays in-game UI and let the user interact with it. For example: The
    * title screen, the game menu, etc. 
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Object_Layout
    * @extends gs.Object_Base
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (layoutName) ->
        super()
        #super(null, null, gs.SceneManager)
        
        ###*
        * Indicates that the UI layout is still in prepare-state and not ready.
        * @property preparing
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @preparing = yes
        
        ###*
        * The layout descriptor.
        * @property layoutData
        * @type Object
        ###
        @layoutName = layoutName
        @layoutData = ui.UiFactory.layouts[layoutName]
        
        ###*
        * The behavior-component for the UI layour specific behavior.
        * @property behavior
        * @type gs.Component_LayoutSceneBehavior
        ###
        if @layoutData?.component
            @behavior = new window[@layoutData.component.ns || "gs"][@layoutData.component.className]
        else
            @behavior = new gs.Component_LayoutSceneBehavior()
        
        ###*
        * Indicates if the UI layout is visible.
        * @property visible
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @visible = yes
 
        ###*
        * An event-emitter to emit events.
        * @property events
        * @type gs.Component_EventEmitter
        ###
        @events = new gs.Component_EventEmitter()
        
        @addComponent(new gs.Component_InputHandler())
        @addComponent(@behavior)
        
        
        
gs.Object_Layout = Object_Layout
